author: Simon Difford
description: While bartenders in other cities have complicated the Sazerac by using a combination of spirits (us included), in New Orleans they keep it simple: straight rye whiskey with a dash of sugar, stirred and strained into an Herbsaint washed glass.
name: Sazerac Cocktail (New Orleans style)
recipeIngredient: 45 ml Straight rye whiskey (100 proof / 50% alc./vol.)
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0Â°brix)

recipeInstructions.text: Ice glass and set to one side
Separately, in another glass stir other ingredients with ice
Discard ice in the now chilled set aside glass and rinse with absinthe (or Herbsaint)
Then strain drink into absinthe/Herbsaint washed glass
